citations.narrative:
The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs is missing required elements. The PVC does not include an
appropriate schedule for the sampling and treatment of intestinal parasites. The current iteration of the PVC in use at the
facility states stool samples will be tested on 20% of the kennel or as needed. The schedule does not prescribe how
frequently stool samples should be obtained from the dogs. The facility has not performed routine fecal sampling since
2023 per available medical records.
Failure to have an appropriate schedule for sampling of intestinal parasites in the PVC does not ensure that the facility is
protecting the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and
unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The PVC must include a schedule for the treatment and sampling of parasites
including worms, coccidia, and giardia approved by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by 30 September 2025
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 15 November 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs is missing required elements. The PVC does not include an 
appropriate schedule for the sampling and treatment of intestinal parasites. The current iteration of the PVC in use at the 
facility states stool samples will be tested on 20% of the kennel or as needed. The schedule does not prescribe how 
frequently stool samples should be obtained from the dogs. The facility has not performed routine fecal sampling since 
2023 per available medical records.  
Failure to have an appropriate schedule for sampling of intestinal parasites in the PVC does not ensure that the facility is 
protecting the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and 
unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The PVC must include a schedule for the treatment and sampling of parasites 
including worms, coccidia, and giardia approved by the attending veterinarian.  
Correct by 30 September 2025 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 15 November 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
